required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Electronic and Mail Outreach From Primary Care Physicians for COVID-19 Vaccination Among Elderly Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Electronic and Mail Outreach From Primary Care Physicians for COVID-19 Vaccination Among Elderly Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized controlled trial tested the effect of culturally tailored and standard electronic secure messages and mailings from patients' primary care physicians to encourage COVID-19 vaccination among adults aged 65 and older.

detailed_description.textblock: This randomized controlled trial tested the effect of culturally tailored and standard electronic secure messages and mailings from patients' primary care physicians to encourage COVID-19 vaccination among adults aged 65 and older. Patients who had not received a COVID-19 vaccination or appointment after previous outreach attempts were randomized to receive (a) an electronic secure message and/or mail outreach from their PCP, (b) similar outreach with additional culturally tailored content, or (c) usual care. The primary outcome was receipt of COVID-19 vaccination during the 8 weeks after the initial study outreach date.

study_design_info.masking_description: Telephone interviewers were blind to study group assignment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 8 weeks after Study Outreach 1 was sent

arm_group.description: These patients were sent standard outreach messages to promote COVID-19 vaccination.
These patients were sent messages similar to those in the Standard PCP Outreach Group, but with additional culturally tailored content.
These patients were not sent the above study outreach messages, but may have received other messages from their local medical centers or counties.

intervention.description: These patients were sent two study outreach messages. Study Outreach 1 was an electronic secure message sent on behalf of the PCP, encouraging COVID-19 vaccination and designed based on behavioral science principles. Letters were sent to patients who had not signed up for the electronic health record portal. Study Outreach 2 was a postcard sent to all patients who had not been vaccinated or made an appointment by four weeks after Study Outreach 1.
These patients were sent messages similar to those in Standard PCP Outreach, but with additional culturally tailored content and photos.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-
Exclusion Criteria:
Received COVID-19 vaccine prior to Study Outreach 1.

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified data will be shared on submission of a protocol approved by the Kaiser Permanente Northern California Institutional Review Board or Research Determination Official, and contingent on appropriate data sharing agreement being completed.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Deidentified data will be shared on submission of a protocol approved by the Kaiser Permanente Northern California Institutional Review Board or Research Determination Official, and contingent on appropriate data sharing agreement being completed.
